product_overview: APAS Intranet is a comprehensive internal management platform designed for a healthcare organization to centralize communication, streamline HR and maintenance processes, provide IT support, and facilitate employee training and development.
core_goals: Centralize institutional information and communication to improve accessibility and transparency.
Digitalize key Human Resources processes such as paystub delivery, time tracking (ponto), and employee communications.
Automate and streamline internal service requests including IT support, maintenance, and hospital equipment management.
Establish an integrated platform for internal education with courses, assessments, and certification.
Enhance corporate communication through digital billboards, direct messaging, and event management.
key_features: Secure user authentication with CPF, hashed passwords, and role-based access control including password recovery and reset.
Institutional agenda with event management and resource reservation functionalities, including automatic IT ticket creation upon hardware booking.
Human Resources module supporting digital document delivery, digital time clock with supervisor validation, and targeted messaging from HR.
Robust IT support system featuring ticket submission, status tracking, and a knowledge base with searchable technical articles.
Education platform with course catalog, video lessons, integrated quizzes/exams, and automatic generation of completion certificates.
Maintenance and hospital equipment request system for managing service orders efficiently.
Corporate communication tools including a mural for announcements, inter-user messaging system, and staff birthday listings.
user_flow_summary: User logs in securely using their CPF and password, authenticated by session management and role-based permissions.
General users view the institutional dashboard showing news, agenda events, and personal notifications.
Users navigate the agenda module to book resources like projectors or notebooks; hardware reservations trigger IT support tickets automatically.
Employees access HR services to view paystubs, record clock-in/out times with validation, and receive direct communication from HR.
Users submit and track IT or maintenance support tickets via the dedicated modules, with IT staff managing hardware reservations visibility.
Learners enroll in courses, watch lessons, complete assessments, and receive certificates through the education platform.
Facility and CEH staff manage infrastructure and equipment maintenance requests through specific request forms.
Administrators manage users, sectors, permissions, and audit logs, overseeing the entire system configuration.
validation_criteria: Successful login and session management with correct role enforcement.
Accurate creation and management of agenda events and resource reservations with automatic IT ticket linkage.
Accessible and secure delivery of HR documents and reliable time tracking with supervisor approval workflows.
Functioning IT ticket submission, real-time tracking, and accessible knowledge base articles.
Complete education workflows including course enrollment, lesson delivery, assessment scoring, and certificate issuance.
Effective handling of maintenance and CEH requests with status updates.
Robust corporate communication features including message delivery, announcement posting, and birthday listings that refresh correctly.
Security measures preventing SQL injection, proper input sanitization, and prevention of unauthorized file uploads.
